questions.question: What is the Agile Manifesto's view on documentation?
questions.correctAnswer: Working software over comprehensive documentation

questions.question: What is a 'Sprint'?
options: A time-boxed period to complete a set amount of work
questions.correctAnswer: A time-boxed period to complete a set amount of work

questions.question: Who owns the Product Backlog?
questions.correctAnswer: Product Owner

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Daily Scrum'?
options: To synchronize activities and create a plan for the next 24 hours
questions.correctAnswer: To synchronize activities and create a plan for the next 24 hours

questions.question: What represents the amount of work remaining in a Sprint?
questions.correctAnswer: Burndown Chart

questions.question: What is a 'User Story'?
options: A description of a feature from an end-user perspective
questions.correctAnswer: A description of a feature from an end-user perspective

questions.question: What does 'Kanban' emphasize?
options: Visualizing work, limiting work in progress, and maximizing flow
questions.correctAnswer: Visualizing work, limiting work in progress, and maximizing flow

questions.question: What is a 'Retrospective'?
options: A meeting to inspect the past Sprint and plan for improvements
questions.correctAnswer: A meeting to inspect the past Sprint and plan for improvements

questions.question: What is 'Velocity'?
options: A measure of the amount of work a Team can handle during a single Sprint
questions.correctAnswer: A measure of the amount of work a Team can handle during a single Sprint

questions.question: Who facilitates the Scrum process?
questions.correctAnswer: Scrum Master

questions.question: What is 'Acceptance Criteria'?
options: The conditions that a software product must satisfy to be accepted by a user
questions.correctAnswer: The conditions that a software product must satisfy to be accepted by a user

questions.question: What is 'TDD'?
questions.correctAnswer: Test Driven Development

questions.question: What is 'Pair Programming'?
options: Two developers work together at one workstation
questions.correctAnswer: Two developers work together at one workstation

questions.question: What is 'Continuous Integration'?
options: Integrating code into a shared repository frequently
questions.correctAnswer: Integrating code into a shared repository frequently

questions.question: What is 'Refactoring'?
options: Improving the internal structure of code without changing its external behavior
questions.correctAnswer: Improving the internal structure of code without changing its external behavior

questions.question: What is 'Technical Debt'?
options: The cost of additional rework caused by choosing an easy solution now instead of a better approach
questions.correctAnswer: The cost of additional rework caused by choosing an easy solution now instead of a better approach

questions.question: What is the 'Definition of Done' (DoD)?
options: A shared understanding of what it means for work to be complete
questions.correctAnswer: A shared understanding of what it means for work to be complete

questions.question: What is 'Planning Poker'?
options: A consensus-based technique for estimating effort
questions.correctAnswer: A consensus-based technique for estimating effort

questions.question: What is 'Time-boxing'?
options: Setting a fixed amount of time for an activity
questions.correctAnswer: Setting a fixed amount of time for an activity

questions.question: What is a 'Spike'?
options: A task aimed at answering a question or gathering information
questions.correctAnswer: A task aimed at answering a question or gathering information

questions.question: What is 'Mob Programming'?
options: The whole team works on the same thing, at the same time, in the same space, and at the same computer
questions.correctAnswer: The whole team works on the same thing, at the same time, in the same space, and at the same computer

questions.question: What is 'Behavior Driven Development' (BDD)?
options: A process that encourages collaboration via examples/scenarios
questions.correctAnswer: A process that encourages collaboration via examples/scenarios

questions.question: What is the difference between Scrum and Waterfall?
options: Scrum is iterative/flexible, Waterfall is sequential/rigid
questions.correctAnswer: Scrum is iterative/flexible, Waterfall is sequential/rigid

questions.question: What is 'Scope Creep'?
questions.correctAnswer: Uncontrolled growth of project scope

questions.question: What is 'MVP'?
questions.correctAnswer: Minimum Viable Product

questions.question: What is 'Extreme Programming' (XP)?
options: An agile software development framework that aims to produce higher quality software
questions.correctAnswer: An agile software development framework that aims to produce higher quality software

questions.question: What is 'Cross-functional Team'?
options: A team that has all the skills necessary to create value
questions.correctAnswer: A team that has all the skills necessary to create value

questions.question: What is 'Self-Managing Team'?
options: Teams that manage their own work and decisions
questions.correctAnswer: Teams that manage their own work and decisions

questions.question: What is 'Cycle Time'?
options: The time from start of work to delivery
questions.correctAnswer: The time from start of work to delivery

questions.question: What is 'Lead Time'?
options: The time from customer request to delivery
questions.correctAnswer: The time from customer request to delivery

questions.question: What is 'Lean Software Development'?
options: Eliminate waste, amplify learning, decide as late as possible, deliver as fast as possible
questions.correctAnswer: Eliminate waste, amplify learning, decide as late as possible, deliver as fast as possible

questions.question: What is 'Servant Leadership'?
options: A philosophy where the leader's main goal is to serve
questions.correctAnswer: A philosophy where the leader's main goal is to serve

questions.question: What is 'Empiricism' in Scrum?
options: Knowledge comes from experience and making decisions based on what is known
questions.correctAnswer: Knowledge comes from experience and making decisions based on what is known

questions.question: What are the three pillars of Scrum?
questions.correctAnswer: Transparency, Inspection, Adaptation

questions.question: What is 'Continuous Deployment'?
options: Every change that passes all stages of your production pipeline is released to your customers
questions.correctAnswer: Every change that passes all stages of your production pipeline is released to your customers

questions.question: What is 'Shift Left' testing?
options: Testing early in the development lifecycle
questions.correctAnswer: Testing early in the development lifecycle

questions.question: What is 'Feature Toggle'?
options: A technique to turn features on or off without deploying new code
questions.correctAnswer: A technique to turn features on or off without deploying new code

questions.question: What is 'Trunk Based Development'?
options: Developers merge small, frequent updates to a core 'trunk' or main branch
questions.correctAnswer: Developers merge small, frequent updates to a core 'trunk' or main branch

questions.question: What is 'Kaizen'?
questions.correctAnswer: Continuous Improvement

questions.question: What is 'Value Stream Mapping'?
options: Visualizing the flow of material and information required to bring a product to the customer
questions.correctAnswer: Visualizing the flow of material and information required to bring a product to the customer

questions.question: What is 'The Three Amigos'?
questions.correctAnswer: Business Analyst, Developer, Tester

questions.question: What is 'INVEST' in User Stories?
options: Independent, Negotiable, Valuable, Estimable, Small, Testable
questions.correctAnswer: Independent, Negotiable, Valuable, Estimable, Small, Testable

questions.question: What is 'Dry' principle?
questions.correctAnswer: Don't Repeat Yourself

questions.question: What is 'KISS' principle?
questions.correctAnswer: Keep It Simple, Stupid

questions.question: What is 'YAGNI' principle?
questions.correctAnswer: You Aren't Gonna Need It

questions.question: What is 'SOLID'?
options: Five design principles for object-oriented programming
questions.correctAnswer: Five design principles for object-oriented programming

questions.question: What is 'Cone of Uncertainty'?
options: The evolution of the amount of uncertainty during a project
questions.correctAnswer: The evolution of the amount of uncertainty during a project

questions.question: What is 'Information Radiator'?
options: A visual display used to convey information to the team/stakeholders (e.g., Kanban board)
questions.correctAnswer: A visual display used to convey information to the team/stakeholders (e.g., Kanban board)

questions.question: What is 'Bus Factor'?
options: The risk of losing key knowledge if team members disappear
questions.correctAnswer: The risk of losing key knowledge if team members disappear

questions.question: What is 'Walking Skeleton'?
options: A tiny implementation of the system that performs a small end-to-end function
questions.correctAnswer: A tiny implementation of the system that performs a small end-to-end function
